title: The Mystery Sticky Notes
setting: Oakridge Financial Group, open office, Wednesday 8 AM
premise: Someone covered every surface of the CEO's glass-walled office with hundreds of bright pink sticky notes overnight, spelling out 'CASUAL FRIDAY OR ELSE.' The CEO's office requires a keycard only four employees possess.

suspects.name: Reggie Thornton
suspects.motive: Has been the most vocal advocate for casual dress code for over a year
suspects.alibi: I was at a compliance conference in the Hilton downtown from Tuesday through Wednesday morning. I checked in Tuesday at 3 PM and the first session Wednesday was at 8 AM.

suspects.name: Pam Delgado
suspects.motive: The CEO rejected her casual Friday proposal without even reading it
suspects.alibi: I left at 5:30 PM Tuesday. I went to my book club meeting at the downtown library from 7 to 10 PM. Eight members attended and the librarian locked up after us.

suspects.name: Oliver Grant
suspects.motive: Bet a colleague fifty dollars he could pull off 'the greatest office prank of the year'
suspects.alibi: I was at the office until 6 PM Tuesday then drove to visit my parents in Millbrook, which is two hours north. I stayed overnight and drove back Wednesday morning.

suspects.name: Simone Watts
suspects.motive: Privately supports casual Friday and wants to pressure the CEO with a harmless stunt
suspects.alibi: I worked late Tuesday until about 9 PM reviewing quarterly figures. Then I drove straight to my house in the suburbs. My home security camera shows me arriving at 9:35 PM.

clues.title: Sticky Note Supply
clues.content: The office supply room is missing twelve packs of pink sticky notes. The supply room log shows someone accessed it at 10:45 PM Tuesday using a keycard.

clues.title: Keycard Holders
clues.content: Only four people have keycards that open both the CEO's office and the supply room: Pam (executive secretary), Simone (CFO), the CEO himself, and the head of security (who was on a flight to Denver Tuesday night).

clues.title: Library Closure Records
clues.content: The downtown library was closed all day Tuesday for emergency plumbing repairs. Their social media posted the closure notice Monday afternoon. No book club meeting could have taken place there.

hints.text: Consider who has both keycard access and an unverifiable alibi for Tuesday night.
Could the venue where one suspect claims to have spent the evening actually have been open that day?
